description: Borrowed from French braille, named after French educator Louis Braille (1809–1852). The /eɪl/ seems to reflect a spelling-pronunciation; French has /aj/ instead.

entries.meaning: Of, relating to or written in braille.

A system of writing in which letters and some combinations of letters are represented by raised dots arranged in three rows of two dots each and are read by the blind and partially sighted using the fingertips.

verbs.description: braille (third-person singular simple present brailles, present participle brailling, simple past and past participle brailled)

entries.meaning: To write in, or convert into, the braille writing system.
examples: I played back my recorded notes and brailled them.

entries.meaning: (informal, by extension) to identify something by touch.
